thread.title: Reader contest: Fly to Tokyo with Qantas – six flights to be won!
thread.title_full: Reader contest: Fly to Tokyo with Qantas – six flights to be won! - Australian Business Traveller

author: David Flynn
title: Reader contest: Fly to Tokyo with Qantas – six flights to be won!
text:
Get ready to jet to Tokyo with Qantas in this exclusive Australian Business Traveller reader contest!
Be part of the launch of Qantas’ newest international routes to Tokyo, with one business class return ticket and five economy return tickets up for grabs – that’s six chances to win, and a prize pool worth over $13,000.
The lights of Tokyo beckon in this great AusBT reader contest Your Tokyo adventure will begin on the inaugural QF61 service from Brisbane to Tokyo’s Narita Airport, departing Brisbane at 11am on Saturday August 1st – with some special ‘first flight festivities' before take-off!
Fly from Brisbane to Tokyo in style in the new Qantas A330 Business Suite The flight will run on Qantas’ latest Airbus A330 with all-new Business Suites in business class (above) and comfortable Recaro seats in economy.
Once you reach Narita Airport at 7.15pm, your time is all your own: stay in Tokyo as long as you like and wherever you choose, from a five-star hotel to an authentic ryokan (transfers, accommodation and associated costs are at the winner’s expense).
After landing in Tokyo, explore Japan at your leisure Your return flight to Australia will be on Qantas’ Boeing 747 from Tokyo’s conveniently-located Haneda Airport to Sydney, at a date of your choosing.
Note that as a condition of entry, winners must
be able to travel on August 1st on the inaugural QF Brisbane-Tokyo flight pay for their own transfers, accommodation, meals and other ground expenses in Japan arrange any necessary connecting flights within Australia, such as flying to Brisbane for the QF61 inaugural, or flying from Sydney after their return on the QF26 service from Tokyo If you're good with those conditions, then entering this contest is a doddle: just share in up to 25 words why you’d like to fly to Tokyo with Qantas.
Name * : * * Email * : In up to 25 words, tell us why you'd like to fly to Tokyo with Qantas... *required This contest is open to residents of Australia aged 16 years and over; entries close at 11.59pm EST on Sunday 26 July 2015, and the winner will be announced on Australian Business Traveller on Monday 27 July 2015 (click here to read the full terms and conditions).
Follow Australian Business Traveller on Twitter: we're @AusBT

0 report reply 2 45 minutes ago by rebekkap Fingers crossed for that amazing new business suite! I did my best poetry writing in 25 words or less!
0 report reply 1 17 minutes ago by David Well as this is a flight to Tokyo, I hope your poetry was in haiku form? Seriously though, as long as you're good to fly BNE-NRT on Sat August 1st that's a start!
